Author: Don King#8901
Content:
@hastrup , anonymint believes CSW will start dumping tulip trust Bitcoin just before the halving next year, at the same time he will attack Bitcoin chain to making it impossible for people to move their coins onto exchanges to dump. The theory is BSV is a red herring,  and TPTB intend to use the pre segwit Bitcoin that remains after this attack as the basis for a new global monetary system.  As jl777 said, the safe thing to do is store your Bitcoin in legacy addresses that start with a 1.
There's a thread on bitcointalk that discusses this theory in some detail, https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5147618.0

Author: Don King#8901
Content: It's a wild theory, but possible

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: Thx üòÅ

Author: LocoMB#8593
Content: interesting stuff, worth a close look!

Author: Don King#8901
Content: The tweet where CSW originally announced his 'advanced notice' was deleted when his Twitter account was removed, but there are screenshots in the thread I posted from BTT. The theory is because CSW intends to dump millions of Bitcoin he needs to give advanced warning to the market to comply with securities regulations. My thinking is segwit is an abomination anyway, so using legacy addresses is sensible no matter what, and while I doubt CSW is Satoshi,  he might have been involved with the Satoshi group, and might be the last one alive, and might actually get access to the tulip trust coins on Jan 1 2020. Either way, only a few weeks to wait before we know one way or the other.

Author: Don King#8901
Content: Better to stay safe and move all Bitcoin into legacy addresses

Content:
What is this world, I wake up and people are talking about anonymint. I have a couple of comments.  Has, as anonymint mentioned, the IRS set up a new attack on Bitcoin?

Accordingly, an airdrop coin has taxes due once you receive it. Anonymint is speculating that CW drives up BTC core price, forks legacy off, stalls core chain, you now owe big taxes but can't move your coins . Price craters. You still owe big taxes, rekt

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the BTC price seems to be priced at rock bottom, likely the larger players (miners, traders) trying to push out the smaller. halving is 6 months away, but still there is not much price action that correlates to that. how close to halving will it be before the bulls take over?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or maybe this time around it really is different and halving wont have any noticeable effect

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i lean toward the larger players trying to push out the smaller theory, but with all the derivatives on BTC now, it can be controlled with paper money, so it could be that the next high wont even reach the ATH. then again we could see $35k BTC and i wouldnt be surprised at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: tl:dr nobody knows and current price seems a slightly low but not unreasonable price. considering just several years ago the ATH was $1200 and it went down to $200 during the bear market, if $3000 was in fact the low this cycle, that means the prices are 10x.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think last cycle at the peak, the price went to 10x mining costs. that would get us in the 50k range with current mining costs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but even a 3x to 4x mining costs at the peak gets us back to 20k, so there are a lot of things that will be clarified between now and a year from now.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: probably there is no easy way to get 200 BTC at market price. i think the average paid was a 20% premium, maybe a bit less. if to buy slowly, the price could easily go up a lot more, that is 10x to 20x the normal daily volumes, ie. 2weeks to a months worth on binance during the low volume times. so what happens if the price is going up every day for 5 days in a row, we just saw the price double from below 6k sats

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe 20% premium was assessed as close to the best possible, though i would imagine it possible to have achieved it for 10% premium over 2 days, instead of all in an hour

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: another theory is that two billionaires made a side bet that KMD price would go down the day deposits reopened and 200BTC was much smaller than their sidebet, or winning that bet was worth 40 BTC to whoever did it
